plants.name: Magnolia Ã— soulangeana
plants.description: A hybrid magnolia tree known for its large, saucer-shaped flowers that appear before the leaves. The blooms are fragrant and come in shades of white, pink, and purple.
plants.location: Temperate regions of North America, Europe, and Asia
plants.funFact: Saucer magnolias bloom early in spring and are some of the first trees to flower, often before other leaves emerge.

plants.name: Narcissus pseudonarcissus
plants.description: A wildflower species producing bright yellow trumpet-shaped flowers in early spring. It grows naturally in woodland and grassland areas.
plants.location: Europe, especially the UK and western Europe
plants.funFact: Wild daffodils are important early nectar sources for bees emerging from winter dormancy.

plants.name: Prunus serrulata
plants.description: A deciduous tree famous for its stunning pink to white blossoms that bloom briefly in spring. It is highly celebrated in Japan and many temperate climates worldwide.
plants.location: Japan, East Asia, and cultivated worldwide
plants.funFact: Cherry blossoms symbolize the transient nature of life due to their short blooming period.

plants.name: Grevillea rosmarinifolia
plants.description: An Australian shrub with needle-like leaves and spider-like red or pink flowers, blooming prominently in spring.
plants.funFact: Grevilleas are bird-pollinated, attracting honeyeaters with their nectar-rich flowers.
